required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: C Scope Visualization System Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: Performance and Safety of the C Scope Visualization System in Arthroscopic Procedures - A Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation of the performance and safety of the C Scope Visualization System

detailed_description.textblock:
The C Scope Visualization System Prospective Study is a post-market, single-arm, prospective, multicenter study conducted in the United States.
The purpose of the study is to evaluate the performance and safety of the C Scope Visualization System in the illumination and visualization of joints from diagnostic procedure through 1-week and 1-month follow-up.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Evaluation of the performance and safety of the C Scope Visualization System in the illumination and visualization of joints during diagnostic procedures

primary_outcome.measure: Physician-rated procedural (diagnostic only) illumination and visualization with the C-Scope Visualization System
primary_outcome.description: Physician-rated procedural (diagnostic only) illumination and visualization of the areas with the C-Scope Visualization System of the joint intended to be evaluated using a 5-point scale:

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician-rated confidence of diagnosis with the C-Scope Visualization System
secondary_outcome.description: Physician-rated confidence of diagnosis following needle arthroscopy attributed to visualization performance of the device using a 5-point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician-rated needle arthroscopy procedural ease with the C-Scope Visualization System
secondary_outcome.description: Physician-rated needle arthroscopy procedural ease using a 5- point scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedure time with the C-Scope Visualization System
secondary_outcome.description: Procedure time (from start of arthroscopy to end of procedure)

other_outcome.description: Adverse events/serious adverse event rates related to the procedure or device

arm_group.description: The C Scope Visualization System is indicated to be used by a trained physician to provide illumination and visualization in arthroscopic procedures of an interior cavity of the body through a surgical opening.

intervention.description: The C Scope Visualization System is indicated to be used by a trained physician to provide illumination and visualization in arthroscopic procedures of an interior cavity of the body through a surgical opening.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is 18 years of age or older
- Subject can fluently speak and read English
- Subject is able to provide informed consent
- Subject agrees to all protocol-required follow-ups
- Subject meets the C Scope Indications for Use according to approved labeling
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of open surgery to the index joint resulting in scarring that might inhibit evaluation with the C Scope Visualization System
- Suspected fracture of joint structures
- Subject has any contraindications listed in the approved labeling including active infection
- In the opinion of the investigator, it is not in the subject's best interest to participate in the study
